name: Tea Olive
climate: Tea Olive thrives in warm and humid climates, typically found in USDA zones 7 to 11.
It can tolerate short periods of cold temperatures but prefers subtropical environments.
Humidity levels should be moderate to high for optimal growth.
It is not frost-hardy and may need protection in colder climates.
sunlight: Tea Olive requires full sun to partial shade to thrive optimally.
The plant benefits from some afternoon shade in extremely hot regions.
Direct morning sunlight helps with better flowering and growth.
Avoid deep shade as it may result in sparse foliage and limited blooms.
watering: Tea Olive needs regular watering, especially during its first growing season.
Ensure the soil is kept consistently moist but not waterlogged to prevent root rot.
Reduce watering in the winter months when the plant is less active.
In hotter climates, more frequent watering may be necessary to maintain soil moisture.
soil: Tea Olive prefers well-draining soil rich in organic matter for best growth.
It can grow in a variety of soil types but thrives in loamy, fertile soils.
Ensure the soil has a slightly acidic to neutral pH for optimal health.
Adding mulch can help retain soil moisture and maintain a stable temperature.
extra_care_tip: Pruning Tea Olive after flowering can help maintain a desirable shape.
Consider applying a balanced fertilizer in spring to encourage blooming.
Regularly check for pests such as spider mites and scale insects.
Mulching around the base can prevent weed growth and conserve moisture.
